topics.body:
Everyone's worst fears has happened: the Ebola outbreak has spread into the Congo.


Reason why this is bad is that everyone was expecting the outbreak to be isolated due to geographic reasons to northwest Africa.  Now there is nothing to stop it from spreading to the rest of Africa.

WHO is saying that it's a different strain, but this has reached epic levels of "shit" because they're already stretched paper thin dealing with the outbreak in northwest Africa and simply put no one has the resources or abilities to stop a outbreak in Congo as well.  Countries are already shutting down travel and borders.

In other words, "shit".

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53fae31f6368720701ef0000#post_53fae31f6368720701ef0000
The USA is already ready for any potential outbreak and have increased airport security.  The USA and most countries are prepared for a potential outbreak.  The problem is africa and the middle east; to put it simply they could not handle such a outbreak and if it gets as bad as they're worried about it'll sweep right through them like a wrecking ball.

The reason why everyone is worried about africa and the middle east is that simply put they don't have the ability to fight such a outbreak, sanitation in a lot of these countries is bad and the quality of health is really bad.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53fae3546368726282ae0100#post_53fae3546368726282ae0100
[bq="SeraphimDawn"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53fae27a6368720caec80000#post_53fae27a6368720caec80000
Where did this pandemic begin in the first place?
If this keeps up, they're gonna have to cremate Africa.[/bq]
Chances are a ton of countries in africa are going to shut down transportation, airplane travel, travel by water, borders and such and the only option at that point is to let it burn itself out.

The downside is we're talking quite a number of people dying though.

It sounds like a dick move, but at this point that's probably the best option; there isn't enough medicine to go around and keeping transportation open will only spread it to more people.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
According to /r/Europe... The Swedish police (in my opinion correctly) recignize that the far left in that country is a bigger threat than the far right (the Swedish Democrats video is them, really not scary people).

Now far right for Sweden is not very far right. Modi in India is farther right and he's no Nazi.

If you see headlines that refer to far right European parties as simply being "far right" (like the huffington post did) then be wary of scare tactics. The Swedish far left for example is a lot more violent and underhanded as there are videos of them going after people.

But to the matter at hand, it looks like Sweden will be going under some radical changes.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53fae99363687206d2100000#post_53fae99363687206d2100000
Long explanation short:
The infected countries can't fight it.
Quarantine procedures are constantly being broken due to people not knowing enough about the virus.
Not enough medicine to go around.
Low standard of health in infected countries.
Numerous people are running out of quarantine zones out of fear when they're already infected thus infecting more people.
Even doctors are breaking quarantine procedures.
Infected people making a run for it out of fear when they know they're already infected.

All of these are contributing to by the time we find out one person is infected two more are infected already.

To use a analogy it's like trying to clean a toilet in a truckstop; it's never going to get clean.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
